byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joe Cochrane from Langsa, Indonesia; Wai Moe from Yangon, Myanmar; Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok; Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong; and Helene Cooper from Washington.

abstract: Signs point to possibility that Southeast Asian migrant crisis is easing; Malaysian and Indonesian search-and rescue vessels have sighted no more refugees from Bangladesh and Myanmar at sea.
lead_paragraph: While no one is willing to say there are no more migrant boats at sea, an absence of landings and a paucity of sightings suggest that the worst may be over.

headline.main: Migrant Crisis in Southeast Asia Shows Signs of Ebbing
headline.print_headline: Signs, but No Certainty, That Asian Migration Crisis May Be Abating

snippet: While no one is willing to say there are no more migrant boats at sea, an absence of landings and a paucity of sightings suggest that the worst may be over.

keywords.value: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
